question_text: A system has an M.2 NVMe SSD installed, but the BIOS lists it under 'PCIe devices' instead of 'Drives'. Why?
answer_options: The NVMe drive is not bootable
The M.2 NVMe interface is routed through PCIe lanes
The M.2 slot is in legacy mode
correct_answer: The M.2 NVMe interface is routed through PCIe lanes
explanation: M.2 NVMe SSDs communicate over PCIe, so the BIOS may list them under PCIe devices instead of traditional SATA storage.
